means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯特德住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“庄园，农场”(estate,farm)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯特德绰号，或职业名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“种马”(stud horse,stallion)

sentence.Network_en: My years of teaching stood me in good stead.
sentence.Network_cn: 多年的执教经验令我大受裨益。

sentence.Network_en: I've always felt that solid experience would stand me in good stead.
sentence.Network_cn: 我总觉得实实在在的经历会对我有利的。

sentence.Network_en: We hope you will consent to act in his stead.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们希望你会同意代理他的职务。

jx.jx_en_mean: be advantageous or useful to someone over time or in the future
jx.jx_cn_mean: （将来）对某人有好处，对某人有用处

lj.lj_ly: his early training stood him in good stead.
lj.lj_ls: 他早期受的训练对他的将来有好处。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stede 'place', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stad 'town', German Statt 'place', Stadt 'town', from an Indo-European root shared by the verb stand

entry.def: If you do something in someone's stead, you replace them and do it instead of them.

example.ex: We hope you will consent to act in his stead...
example.tran: 我们希望你会同意代理他的职务。

example.ex: My grandmother and aunt will be there in my parents' stead.
example.tran: 我的祖母和姑妈将代替我的父母出席。

entry.def: If you say that something will stand someone in good stead, you mean that it will be very useful to them in the future.

example.ex: These two games here will stand them in good stead for the future...
example.tran: 现在的这两场比赛将对他们今后很有利。

example.ex: My years of teaching stood me in good stead.
example.tran: 多年的执教经验令我大受裨益。

means.word_mean: 1. the function or position properly or customarily occupied or served by another;

sentences.en: Foxton was dismissed and John Smith was appointed in his stead.
sentences.cn: 福克斯顿被解职了，约翰·史密斯被任命接替他。
